channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Part of 'Banksy' artwork in Lowestoft removed over flood fears
item.description: A small, metal "boat" under a painting of three children was taken away by contractors, a council says.

item.title: Wood Green stabbing: Man charged with social worker attack
item.description: Sulai Bukhari is charged with attempted murder after the man and two police officers were attacked.

item.title: Kent footballer alleges player hurled homophobic abuse during game
item.description: Sheppey United's Jahmal Howlett-Mundle says a Tower Hamlets player made a comment during a match.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai's family 'so proud' of gold medal win
item.description: The flyweight boxer beat Carlo Paalam on Saturday while his family watched from Birmingham.

item.title: Lulworth Cove: Search under way for missing Jurassic Coast diver
item.description: An air and sea search resumes after the diver was reported missing on Saturday evening.

item.title: Peter Kay: Thousands watch comic make live return at charity event
item.description: The star, who hasn't performed for years, held two Q&As to raise cash for a young woman with cancer.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB match London 2012 with 65 medals won as Kenny and Price take gold
item.description: Cyclist Jason Kenny's keirin triumph plus boxing gold for Lauren Price mean Team GB's Tokyo Olympics medal haul of 65 matches London 2012's total.

item.title: Geronimo the Alpaca must be put down to protect cows - minister
item.description: Putting animals down is soul-destroying but necessary to stop bovine TB, the environment secretary says.

item.title: Pagan Roman emperor coin found in Norfolk field 'deliberately damaged'
item.description: Emperor Julian wanted to revive pagan worship across the Empire after it officially became Christian.

item.title: Festival of Britain: Sites celebrated for 70th anniversary
item.description: Places linked to the exhibition, which ran from May to September 1951, are given greater protection.

item.title: St Ives swans saved by man who built raft make him 'proud'
item.description: A boatyard worker who saved a swan's nest by building a raft is still watching over the brood.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Chorley friendship group made me smile again, says widower
item.description: Gerald says he felt lonely but has "never looked back" since joining a Chorley friendship group.

item.title: How golf helped a Holocaust survivor
item.description: The club was set up for Jewish people to enjoy golf and is about to celebrate its 90th anniversary.

item.title: Covid in Bradford: 'I just want to see mum and dad one last time'
item.description: Young people in Bradford share their intense experiences of the Covid pandemic in an inner city.

item.title: Covid: Man, 23, 'thought body could brush off virus'
item.description: Patients at the Royal Liverpool Hospital tell BBC North West Tonight about being ill with Covid.

item.title: London riots: 'My shop was burned down but we came back stronger'
item.description: Trevor Reeves and Bushra Ahmed both lost businesses during a night of violence in August 2011.

item.title: Freewheelers blood bike charity recognised for 30 years' service
item.description: Freewheelers uses a team of volunteer motorcyclists to carry blood and medical supplies for the NHS.

item.title: Sky Brown inspiring skateboarding girls to take it 'to the next level'
item.description: Girls in the West share how the skateboarding Olympics has inspired them to take their hobby further.

item.title: Hundreds of harvest mice released to boost Northumberland colony
item.description: Their release will reinforce what is one of the few harvest mouse colonies north of the River Tyne.

item.title: Bronze Age elder's skeleton found at Cambridgeshire dig
item.description: The remains of the "relatively muscular" middle-aged man are found in a funeral mound.

item.title: Redcar rescue dogs' paintings up for auction
item.description: The dogs created their paintings by licking peanut butter from the top of the canvas.

item.title: Rain stalls India in pursuit of 209 to beat England
item.description: Persistent rain delays the start of what could be a grandstand final day in the first Test between England and India at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jason Kenny wins seventh gold but Laura Kenny reign as omnium champion over
item.description: Jason Kenny becomes the first Briton to win seven Olympic golds by defending his keirin title - but wife Laura's reign as women's omnium champion has ended.

item.title: Community Shield: Leicester City 1-0 Manchester City - Kelechi Iheanacho penalty seals silverware
item.description: Substitute Kelechi Iheanacho confidently despatches a late penalty as Leicester stun Manchester City to claim the Community Shield at Wembley.

item.title: Lincoln's Bramall suffers alleged racist abuse at Gillingham
item.description: Lincoln City defender Cohen Bramall allegedly suffers racist abuse from a fan at Gillingham.
